natural solution: Begin by distributing in the innermost parentheses: \begin{align} \left(2x+\frac{3}{2} (4x-6)\right)-&4\left( -(2-x)+\frac{x}{2}\right)\\ &=(2x+6x-9)-4\left(-2+x+\frac{x}{2}\right)\\ &=(8x-9)-4\left (-2+\frac{3x}{2}\right)
\end{align} Now, distribute again, and combine like terms: \begin{align} (8x-9)-4\left (-2+\frac{3x}{2}\right)&=8x-9+8-6x\\ &=\boxed{2x-1} \end{align}

shows  "expr x = 2 * x - 1"
